article_title: Members Of Congress Speak Out Against Private Tax Debt Collections

article_metadata.description: As concerns mounted over the recent proposal to turn over delinquent tax accounts to private debt collectors, Ways and Means Oversight Subcommittee Ranking Member John Lewis (D-GA), Ways and Means Committee Ranking Member Sander Levin (D-MI), and Budget Committee Ranking Member Chris Van Hollen (D-MD) have issued a statement objecting to outsourcing those debts.
article_metadata.author: Kelly Phillips Erb

og.description: As concerns mounted over the recent proposal to turn over delinquent tax accounts to private debt collectors, Ways and Means Oversight Subcommittee Ranking Member John Lewis (D-GA), Ways and Means Committee Ranking Member Sander Levin (D-MI), and Budget Committee Ranking Member Chris Van Hollen (D-MD) have issued a statement objecting to outsourcing those debts.
